did.unittitle: David Weiner Papers on the United Federation of Teachers

physdesc.extent: in 16 manuscript boxes and one half manuscript box

did.abstract: From the 1960s to the 1990s, educator and activist David Weiner was a member of the Teachers Union of New York and the United Federation of Teachers. He was also a member of the left-wing opposition group the Teachers Action Caucus. This collection consists of materials from his involvement in those organizations. Included are correspondence, notes, agendas and minutes, article drafts and publications, newsletters, clippings, broadsides, and promotional materials.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by David Weiner in 2003. The accession number associated with this gift is 2003.028.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: David Weiner was an educator and activist. He was a member of the Teachers Union of New York, and subsequently, the United Federation of Teachers, where he was a member of the left-wing opposition group the Teachers Action Caucus. Weiner also was active in the retired teachers chapter of the UFT, and at one time edited its newsletter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains material related to the United Federation of Teachers (UFT) and the UFT's Teachers Action Caucus and Retired Teachers Committee. The collection also holds materials on 20th-century education issues, such as academic freedom, school desegregation, civil rights, the Cold War, and the Vietnam War. Document types include correspondence, notes, agendas and minutes, article drafts and publications, newsletters, clippings, broadsides, and promotional materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by David Weiner were transferred to New York University in 2003 by David Weiner. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in 2 series: Series I, David Weiner's United Federation of Teachers records; and Series II, Subject files.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were placed in new acid-free folders and boxes. Original label information was retained when possible.
